key_insights: Authentic presence emerges when shame about limitations has been metabolized rather than managed
Performance and image management create split attention that reduces capacity for real connection
Therapist's own relationship to shame is contagious and directly impacts client safety
Real intimacy is based on meeting actual human reality, not curated versions of ourselves
open_questions: What makes the difference between someone still working on metabolizing shame versus someone who has completed that process?
How does okayness with limitations develop internally?
What allows someone to trust that their actual human reality is worth meeting?
threads_explored: The relationship between shame metabolization and authentic presence
How performance vs reality affects relational capacity
The contagious nature of therapeutic presence
The foundation of genuine intimacy in accepting human limitations
